alert.note: Alert for Eastern San Gabriel Mountains; Interstate 5 Corridor; Western San Gabriel Mountains and Highway 14 Corridor (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 21 at 5:48PM PDT until March 22 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM PDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 5 feet above 6000 feet, 10-20 inches between 5000 and 6000 feet, and 2-10 inches between 3500 and 5000 feet. Southerly Winds gusting as high as 75 mph. * WHERE...Interstate 5 Corridor, Western San Gabriel Mountains and Highway 14 Corridor and Eastern San Gabriel Mountains. * WHEN...Until 11 PM PDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Very strong winds could cause extensive tree damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels will drop into the 3000 to 4500 foot range tonight and Wednesday. The snow and wind may cause significant travel delays, including Interstate 5 through Tejon Pass where around 3 inches is expected.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions from CalTrans are available by calling 1 800 4 2 7 7 6 2 3.

area.areaDesc: Eastern San Gabriel Mountains; Interstate 5 Corridor; Western San Gabriel Mountains and Highway 14 Corridor
